Key Match Events: Buddy Hield scored 25 points on 8-for-10 shooting in the second half
Lindy Waters III scored 17 points in his first 17 minutes of action and set a career-high with eight rebounds
The Warriors sank 21 3-pointers compared to just nine for the Pelicans
Brandin Podziemski scored 19 points and dished out five assists
Moses Moody scored 17 points and shot 5-for-6 from three
Jonathan Kuminga added 17 points, including a highlight-reel transition dunk
Post-Match Reflections: Waters also set a career-high with eight rebounds and considers this team the 'best possible fit' for his playstyle
Hield caught fire in the fourth quarter, scoring 19 points on 6-for-8 shooting and a perfect 4-for-4 from deep
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Warriors had a 36-point advantage from behind the arc
The Dubs were without Stephen Curry, Andrew Wiggins and De'Anthony Melton
The Warriors will face these same New Orleans Pelicans on the second night of a back-to-back at Chase Center on Wednesday (7 p.m. PST)
